channel.title: Markets-The Economic Times
channel.description: Stock Market India News and analysis on BSE NSE Stock SENSEX Nifty and Share Market Statistics Global Markets IPOs Real Estate Bonds Forex and Commodity Market & Exchange

item.title: Higher top, higher bottom in the making, should set a solid base for a grand rally
item.description: Despite Donald Trump’s strong message, stocks of IT and pharma companies have remained calm, which depicts their unwillingness to go down further.
item.guid: Article at EconomicTimes.com with article id : 56535256

item.title: Week 2: 10 stocks that surged up to 54% on BSE
item.description: Sensex advanced 1.79 per cent during the second week of 2017. Likewise, the Nifty index of NSE climbed 156.55 points, or 1.90 per cent, to 8,400.35.
item.guid: Article at EconomicTimes.com with article id : 56535171

item.title: A Tata lifer, Chandra is a perfect fit as Tata Sons' chairman: Deepak Parekh, HDFC
item.description: Chandra is a Tata man. He is used to the Tata values and the Tata ethos of doing business. So for him, it is going to be a seamless activity, says Parekh
item.guid: Article at EconomicTimes.com with article id : 56535020

item.title: Donald Trump to take office on January 20; 5 cues to watch for Indian markets
item.description: Donald Trump's tenure as the US President will be marked by uncertainties involving disruptive policymaking in order to protect jobs for US natives.
item.guid: Article at EconomicTimes.com with article id : 56535004

item.title: Prefer infra and power stocks right now: Rajat Sharma, Sana Securities
item.description: I believe it will be interesting to watch out for the public sector banks because that is where lot of the demonetisation money has got deposited, says Sharma
item.guid: Article at EconomicTimes.com with article id : 56534475

item.title: US stock bulls have got it wrong, says Amundi
item.description: “US equity markets could go further into bubble territory as risks are becoming increasingly asymmetric. That would be an opportunity to reallocate funds to bond markets."
item.guid: Article at EconomicTimes.com with article id : 56534432

item.title: Infosys stares at a weak Q4 with anaemic revenue growth
item.description: Infosys said it expected revenue in the dollar terms to grow by 7.2-7.6% for FY17 slashing it from the earlier expectation of 7.5-8.5%.
item.guid: Article at EconomicTimes.com with article id : 56534416

item.title: What can you expect in Union Budget 2017? FM may have good news for auto sector
item.description: Post demonetisation, the forthcoming Union budget, which is scheduled for February 1, would be a litmus test for the government, says DK Aggarwal.
item.guid: Article at EconomicTimes.com with article id : 56534218

item.title: What I read this week: Is India really ready to usher in a universal basic income programme
item.description: Ritesh Jain read some interesting write-ups this week about how water is emerging as one hell of a business and whether earnings really drive market.
item.guid: Article at EconomicTimes.com with article id : 56534118

item.title: Chart reading: Nifty50 looks poised to consolidate; watch IT, infra, metal stocks
item.description: Though a quiet opening is expected to the next week, the Nifty is likely to consolidate in a capped range with 8,445 and 8,520 acting as immediate resistance.
item.guid: Article at EconomicTimes.com with article id : 56534072

item.title: Two stocks to play with on Monday morning: Manas Jaiswal
item.description: One can take a long call, keep the stop loss below 8350 and can set the target of 8510. Next week, Nifty can test 8510, says Jaiswal.
item.guid: Article at EconomicTimes.com with article id : 56534057

item.title: 2017 could be cyclically a very good year for largecap IT: Hiren Ved, Alchemy Capital
item.description: If you really look at the long term in India, every disturbance or opportunity has been an opportunity to buy unless the valuations have been completely out of whack, says Ved
item.guid: Article at EconomicTimes.com with article id : 56533606

item.title: Dalal St doubts Chandrasekaran’s ability to turn around larger companies; TCS slumps most at 4%
item.description: Trent was the biggest gainer among Tata stocks on Friday, soaring 8.7%. Tata Coffee rose 6.12%. Tata Global, Indian Hotels and Rallis India gained 2% each.
item.guid: Article at EconomicTimes.com with article id : 56531032

item.title: With 4% drop, TCS emerges as biggest loser in tech pack; Infy dips 2.5% on trimmed guidance
item.description: While TCS posted in-line growth and margin, we remain concerned as growth was driven by volatile markets, which entail the potential of springing a negative surprise going forward.
item.guid: Article at EconomicTimes.com with article id : 56514571

item.title: Infosys narrows guidance range, Q3 net profit at Rs 3.7k crore
item.description: The company also appointed its head of delivery Ravikumar S as deputy chief operating officer reporting to the COO UB Pravin Rao.
item.guid: Article at EconomicTimes.com with article id : 56511900
